00052 string Convert::toString(int i) {
00053   stringstream ss;
00054   string str;
00055   ss << i;
00056   ss >> str;
00057   return str;
00058 }

00066 std::string Convert::toString(double d) {
00067   stringstream ss;
00068   string str;
00069   ss << d;
00070   ss >> str;
00071 
00072   // we prefer the linux format (inf/nan) to that of the windows output.
00073   // convert the strings to our perfered format.
00074 #ifdef WIN32
00075   if (str == "-1.#INF") {
00076     str="-inf";
00077   } 
00078   else if (str == "1.#INF") {
00079     str="inf";
00080   }
00081   else if (str == "-1.#IND") {
00082     str="nan";
00083   }
00084   else if (str == "1.#IND") {
00085     str="nan";
00086   }
00087 #endif
00088   return str;
00089 }

00097 int Convert::toInt(const std::string& num) {
00098   bool success = true;
00099   int i = Convert::toIntCheck(num, &success);
00100   if(success != true)
00101     Err::errAbort("Could not convert '" + std::string(num) + "' to an int.");
00102   return i;
00103 }
00104 
00112 int Convert::toIntCheck(const std::string& num, bool *success) {
00113   long int l = 0;
00114   int i = 0;
00115   bool ok = true;
00116   char *end = NULL;
00117   const char* num_c_str=num.c_str();
00118 
00119   assert(num_c_str); 
00120   errno = 0;
00121   l = strtol(num_c_str, &end, 10);
00122 
00123   // end will be NULL if entire string converted.
00124   ok = (*end != '\0' || end == num_c_str) ? false : true;
00125   
00126   // cast to int and make sure that we didn't overflow
00127   i = (int)l;
00128   if(errno != 0 || (long)i != l)
00129     ok = false;
00130 
00131   // if we had a problem set to 0 for consistency.
00132   if(!ok)
00133     i = 0;
00134 
00135   if(success != NULL)
00136     (*success) = ok;
00137 
00138   return i;
00139 }

00147 unsigned int Convert::toUnsignedInt(const std::string& num) {
00148   bool success = true;
00149   unsigned int i = Convert::toUnsignedIntCheck(num, &success);
00150   if(success != true)
00151     Err::errAbort("Could not convert '" + std::string(num) + "' to an unsigned int.");
00152   return i;
00153 }

00162 unsigned int Convert::toUnsignedIntCheck(const std::string& num, bool *success) {
00163   long unsigned int l = 0;
00164   unsigned int i = 0;
00165   bool ok = true;
00166   char *end = NULL;
00167   const char* num_c_str=num.c_str();
00168 
00169   assert(num_c_str); 
00170   errno = 0;
00171   l = strtoul(num_c_str, &end, 10);
00172 
00173   // end will be NULL if entire string converted.
00174   ok = (*end != '\0' || end == num_c_str) ? false : true;
00175 
00176   // cast to unsigned int and make sure that we didn't overflow
00177   i = (unsigned int)l;
00178   if(errno != 0 || (long unsigned int)i != l || l >= UINT_MAX) 
00179     ok = false;
00180 
00181   // if we had a problem set to 0 for consistency.
00182   if(!ok)
00183     i = 0;
00184 
00185   if(success != NULL)
00186     (*success) = ok;
00187 
00188   return i;
00189 }

00197 float Convert::toFloat(const std::string& num) {
00198   bool success = true;
00199   float f = toFloatCheck(num, &success);
00200   if(!success) 
00201     Err::errAbort("Could not convert '" + std::string(num) + "' to a float.");
00202   return f;
00203 }
00204 
00212 float Convert::toFloatCheck(const std::string& num, bool *success) {
00213   double d = toDoubleCheck(num, success);
00214   if(d >= FLT_MAX && d < DBL_MAX)
00215     (*success) = false;
00216   return float(d);
00217 }

00225 double Convert::toDouble(const std::string& num){
00226   bool success = true;
00227   double d = Convert::toDoubleCheck(num, &success);
00228 
00229   if(!success)
00230     Err::errAbort("Could not convert '" + std::string(num) + "' to a double.");
00231 
00232   return d;
00233 }
00234 
00242 double Convert::toDoubleCheck(const std::string& num, bool *success){
00243   double d = 0;
00244   char *end = NULL;
00245   bool ok = true;
00246   const char* num_c_str=num.c_str();
00247 
00248   assert(num_c_str);
00249   errno = 0;
00250   d = strtod(num_c_str, &end);
00251 
00252   // end will point at NULL if conversion successful
00253   ok = (*end != '\0' || end == num_c_str) ? false : true;
00254 
00255   // errno should be set if over/under flow.
00256   if(errno != 0)
00257     ok = false;
00258   
00259   if(!ok)
00260     d = 0.0;
00261 
00262   if(success != NULL)
00263     (*success) = ok;
00264 
00265   return d;
00266 }

00274 bool Convert::toBool(const std::string& flag) {
00275   bool value = false, success = false;
00276   value = Convert::toBoolCheck(flag, &success);
00277   if(!success)
00278     Err::errAbort("Could not convert '" + std::string(flag) + "' to a boolean.\n"
00279                   "Valid values are: 'true','false','1','0'.");
00280   return value;
00281 }
00282 
00291 bool Convert::toBoolCheck(const std::string& flag, bool *success) {
00292   bool value = false;
00293   bool ok = true;
00294   const char* flag_c_str=flag.c_str();
00295 
00296   assert(flag_c_str);
00297 
00298   // would like to use strcasecmp, but VC++ doesnt have it
00299   if ((strcmp(flag_c_str, "true") == 0) ||
00300       (strcmp(flag_c_str, "TRUE") == 0) ||
00301       (strcmp(flag_c_str, "1")    == 0)) {
00302     value = true;
00303   }
00304   else if ((strcmp(flag_c_str, "false") == 0) ||
00305            (strcmp(flag_c_str, "FALSE") == 0) ||
00306            (strcmp(flag_c_str, "0") == 0)) {
00307     value = false;
00308   }
00309   else 
00310     ok = false;
00311 
00312   if(success != NULL)
00313     (*success) = ok;
00314 
00315   return value;
00316 }
00317 
00324 bool Convert::doubleCloseEnough(double d1, double d2, int digits) {
00325   double diff = fabs(d1 - d2);
00326   if(diff < 1 / (pow(10.0, (double)digits)))
00327     return true;
00328   return false;
00329 }

00337 float Convert::floatLowPrecision(float f) {
00338   return (float)((floor((f+0.05)*10))/10.0);
00339 }
